author: HispanTV
title: ¿Cómo estos dos sionistas buscan llevar al mundo hacia el Armagedón? | HISPANTV
text:
Ucrania e Israel tras sus derrotas en el campo de batalla ante sus rivales intentan para arrastrar el mundo hacia una guerra nuclear, dice un politólogo.
En un artículo publicado el jueves en el diario Rai al-Youm , el politólogo palestino Abdel Bari Atwan abordó el supuesto de que el primer ministro israelí, Benjamín Netanyahu, y el presidente ucraniano, Volodímir Zelenski, se esfuerzan para arrastrar al mundo hacia la batalla del fin del mundo, es decir, Armagedón.
En su escrito, Atwan aseveró que el denominador común entre el sionista israelí Netanyahu y el sionista ucraniano Zelenski es su intento de arrastrar a Estados Unidos y sus aliados de la Organización del Tratado del Atlántico Norte (OTAN) a guerras subsidiarias para librarlos de grandes amenazas a sus respectivos gobiernos y supervivencia: “Irán y sus aliados en Asia Occidental en el caso del primero, y Rusia bajo Putin en el segundo”.
Según Atwan no es coincidencia que el ejército ucraniano, siguiendo las directivas de Zelenski, lanzara un ataque sorpresa el 6 de agosto en la región de Kursk, dentro de las fronteras occidentales de Rusia, afirmando haber tomado 60 aldeas, y una serie de ataques con drones en Moscú y otras ciudades rusas, con el objetivo de desconcertar a las autoridades rusas y obligarlas a aceptar las condiciones de Ucrania para poner fin a la guerra.
Putin: Ucrania conspira para atacar la central nuclear de Kursk | HISPANTV El presidente ruso, Vladimir Putin, afirmó el jueves que las Fuerzas Armadas de Ucrania intentaron atacar la central nuclear de Kursk, ubicada en territorio ruso.
Tras destacar las importancias estratégicas de la región Kursk, el experto resaltó que en esta zona se han encontrado el reactor nuclear y la planta de generación de energía más grandes de Rusia, y una variedad de instalaciones de petróleo y gas. “Zelenski esperaba que los líderes rusos percibieran el peligro y se apresuraran a sentarse a la mesa de negociaciones para buscar un alto el fuego como preludio para resolver el conflicto, de acuerdo con las prescripciones estadounidenses”, agregó.
Atwan subrayó que esta escalada imprudente tuvo resultados contraproducentes y produjo resultados opuestos.
El analista árabe destacó que al principio la portavoz de la Cancillería de Rusia, Maria Zajarova, que aseveró que el gobierno de Kiev busca destruir planta nuclear en Kursk y “si eso hubiera ocurrido, habría desencadenado una guerra nuclear”.
Defensa rusa: Más tanques ucranianos de fabricación occidental destruidos
También, declaró que el vicepresidente del Consejo de Seguridad de Rusia, Dmitri Medvédev, criticó este plan conjunto de Estados Unidos y Ucrania cuando advirtió contra caer en la trampa de las negociaciones (como las negociaciones sobre Asia Occidental en Doha y El Cairo) destacando que la “acción terrorista neonazi en Kursk no quedaría impune”.
HAMAS no participará en nuevos diálogos: Israel los usa para más masacres | HISPANTV HAMAS subraya que “no participará en nuevas conversaciones” con el régimen israelí sobre un alto el fuego en Gaza.
Al hacer alusión a la contraofensiva rusa a la capital ucraniana y el número de las bajas incluidas las 4180 bajas militares y la destrucción de 58 tanques, cientos de vehículos blindados de Ucrania, el columnista recalcó que los 11 drones que tenían como objetivo Moscú en el mayor ataque de este tipo contra la capital rusa, también, fueron derribados y no lograron sus objetivos.
“Netanyahu quiere una guerra nuclear en Irán y Zelenski quiere otra en Rusia, lo que podría llevar a la devastación total de todo Asia Occidental y el continente europeo. Lamentablemente, EE.UU., dominado por los sionistas, sufre un verdadero vacío de liderazgo debido a las próximas elecciones y al retiro forzoso del presidente Biden, lo que podría aprovecharse para involucrarlo en estos dos conflictos catastróficos”, enfatizó Atwan.
El jefe de redacción del diario Rai al-Youm concluyó que Rusia, liderada por Putin y con 5580 ojivas nucleares, no puede ser derrotada.
Atwan aseveró que Moscú ha iniciado ejercicios nucleares con sus sistemas de última generación y ha considerado que el suministro de aviones de guerra F-16 a Ucrania por parte de EE.UU. capaces de atacar en el interior de Rusia, es una línea roja que justificaría una respuesta nuclear táctica o estratégica, incluso con “misiles hipersónicos que pueden llegar a Londres en cuatro minutos y al territorio continental de Estados Unidos en siete”.
El analista árabe concluyó que si todavía quedan cabezas sensatas en Occidente, deben controlar a estos dos sionistas, Netanyahu y Zelenski, antes de que conduzcan al mundo a una devastadora guerra global.
Rusia amenaza con hundir Europa con “misiles hipersónicos” msr/ncl/hnb

author: archyde
title: Ejaculation Benefits: Boost Sexual Satisfaction and Reduce Prostate Cancer Risk
text:
Welcome to the Joyful Science of Ejaculation! Ah, ejaculation! The topic that makes even the bravest of souls squirm in their seats. But let’s not forget, this is not a teenage sleepover; we’re discussing something that, as it turns out, is utterly essential for the gentlemen of the world—like vitamins, but a lot more fun. And guess what? The health benefits are as surprising as finding a fiver in your jeans after a wash.
The Mechanics of Pleasure So, what exactly happens in the male genital region when things heat up? Well, once you’ve decided to engage in a little light sexual stimulation, your blood vessels get a bit of a party—think of it as a blood fest! The penis swells, and voilà, you’re off to the races to reach that glorious sexual climax: ejaculation. It’s like your body’s confetti cannon going off. Who knew biology could be so cheeky?
For Your Health, For Your Health! Now here’s the kicker: not only is ejaculation a cause for celebration, but it also brings along a full suite of health benefits. Yes, this is where science meets pleasure! Researchers have conducted studies—real-life lab coats and all—that suggest that regular ejaculation can reduce stress and even improve your mood. So if you’ve been feeling a little down, maybe it’s time to lighten your ‘load’—if you catch my drift.
But wait, there’s more! High-fiving your prostate through frequent ejaculation may even help lower your risk of, wait for it… prostate cancer! Yes, gentlemen, that’s right. The chum bucket of fate can be swayed by simply engaging in a bit of self-pleasure or a few nights of romance. According to an expansive study with over 32,000 men, those who knocked ‘21 orgasms per month’ off their to-do list reduced their prostate cancer risk by an impressive 20%. Now that’s what I call preventive medicine! Pest control for your reproductive health, if you will.
The Prostate: The Unsung Hero Speaking of incredible, let’s give a round of applause to the prostate—the often-forgotten sidekick that’s been there all along! According to Dr. Anne Calvaresi, chair of the Urologic Care Foundation’s Prostate Health Committee, regular ejaculation helps remove harmful substances that can linger in seminal fluid like bad guests that refuse to leave your party. There’s a great chance that the tomboy with the flip-flops is more sensitive than you think!
Prostate Orgasms: To Infinity and Beyond! If you’re itching for something new (pun intended), Dr. Gigi Engle, a certified sexologist, serves up some tantalizing tips on how to make ejaculation even more pleasurable. You can explore the mystical world of prostate orgasms! Yes, those are a thing—enlightenment in the man cave. A little finger or toy inserted into the rectum could lead to a full-body ride that puts roller coasters to shame. Talk about a one-way ticket to pleasure city!
In Conclusion: Get Down to Business! So, dear readers, it seems that understanding the importance of ejaculation doesn’t just take the load off your mind (pun absolutely intended), but also plays a vital role in promoting prostate health. Whether you’re getting down and dirty with a partner or on your own, taking care of business has never been so critically important.
Now go forth and spread the word—or, should I say, the good news! Let’s all work together to keep our prostates happy and healthy while enjoying the process. So, hands up for health, and pop those fizzies… responsibly!
England, LIVE – Ejaculation, the release of semen from the male genitals, marks the culmination of sexual arousal and is often reached during orgasm. This physiological response not only signifies sexual climax but is also linked to heightened sexual satisfaction, enhancing the overall intimate experience for men.
Ejaculation usually occurs after sexual stimulation, which causes the blood vessels in the penis to dilate, resulting in increased size and rigidity. Importantly, ejaculation may offer various health benefits, such as alleviating stress, boosting mood, and reducing prostate cancer risk, demonstrating its potential role in men’s health.
Quoted by Metro.co.uk on Friday, November 8, 2024, extensive research emphasizes that regular ejaculation may significantly lower the likelihood of developing prostate cancer. The findings suggest that men who achieve ejaculation several times a month may help in preventing this serious health concern.
In addition to providing satisfaction, orgasm also has important health benefits. Studies indicate that men who ejaculate daily are at a considerably lower risk of prostate cancer. In fact, achieving orgasm 21 times per month can result in a striking 20 percent reduction in risk. These insights are crucial, particularly against the grim backdrop of projections indicating that global mortality rates from prostate cancer could potentially double over the next 20 years.
According to a study published in European Urology involving 32,000 men aged 18 and over, researchers found a clear correlation: the more frequently a man ejaculates, the reduced his probability of developing prostate cancer. This significant link underscores the importance of understanding sexual health. Scientists at Harvard Medical School and Brigham and Women’s Hospital further affirm that men can gain from ejaculation through both masturbation and sexual intercourse.
Dr. Anne Calvaresi, chair of the Urologic Care Foundation’s Prostate Health Committee, emphasizes that regular ejaculation can effectively eliminate harmful substances that may accumulate in seminal fluid, potentially mitigating health risks. “It is possible that men who ejaculate frequently have a healthy lifestyle, which indirectly contributes to reducing the risk of prostate cancer,” she noted, suggesting that overall well-being plays a role in sexual health.
To increase orgasm frequency, Dr. Gigi Engle, a certified sexologist, shares valuable tips. One suggestion is incorporating prostate stimulation into sexual activity, whether solo or with a partner. “Men can experience a prostate orgasm without stimulating the penis. A prostate orgasm is a full-body experience that can deliver profound sensations,” Gigi elaborated.
To achieve prostate orgasm, men may employ a finger or instrument inserted into the rectal area, targeting the prostate situated near the navel. Gigi adds that techniques like circular motions or varying insertions can lead to distinct and heightened pleasure. This information is meant to empower men to appreciate the importance of ejaculation for maintaining prostate health and to explore new avenues for enhancing their sexual enjoyment.
Scientists at Harvard Medical School and Brigham and Women’s Hospital have also found that men can benefit from ejaculation through both masturbation and intercourse.
**Interview Segment ⁣with‌ Dr. Anne​ Calvaresi, ​Chair of the Urologic​ Care Foundation’s Prostate Health Committee**
**Host:** Welcome, everyone, to our ‍latest⁣ segment⁤ of “Joyful Science of Ejaculation.” Today, we’re ⁢diving deep into a subject ⁣that merges health ⁢and pleasure: how ejaculation could potentially lower prostate cancer risk. Joining us ‌is Dr. Anne Calvaresi, a leading expert in​ urologic health. Dr. Calvaresi, welcome!
**Dr. Calvaresi:** Thank you for having‍ me! It’s great to be here to discuss such an important ​topic.
**Host:** Absolutely! So, let’s get right into it. Recent studies suggest that frequent‌ ejaculation might ‍lower the risk of prostate ​cancer⁢ by as much as 20%. What are‌ your thoughts on these findings?
**Dr. Calvaresi:** Yes, it’s quite fascinating. The research, particularly a large-scale study⁣ involving over 32,000 men, indicates ⁤that those who ejaculate ⁣more ⁢frequently—around 21 times a month—could significantly reduce their risk⁢ of developing prostate cancer. The underlying idea is that regular ejaculation helps to clear out harmful substances⁢ from⁤ the seminal fluid, potentially reducing cancer risks and improving overall prostate health.
**Host:** So, it sounds like ejaculation isn’t just a matter of pleasure, but⁣ has tangible health benefits as well! Can you elaborate on how this mechanism works?
**Dr. Calvaresi:** Certainly!⁤ When a man ​ejaculates, the process⁤ helps to flush out ⁢toxins⁣ and possibly harmful agents that ⁤can ​accumulate in the prostate. ​Think of it as a natural cleansing. It’s‌ crucial for maintaining prostate health, much⁢ like regular exercise is important for overall fitness. Plus, it’s a way for ⁤the body to maintain its balance.
**Host:** That’s a ‌really interesting perspective! Now, there are also discussions about‌ prostate orgasms—how​ do those fit into this picture?
**Dr. Calvaresi:** Prostate orgasms, facilitated through stimulation of the ​prostate gland, can indeed enhance pleasure ⁣and may contribute to the same⁤ health benefits associated with traditional ejaculation. Exploring different forms of sexual ⁢pleasure, including prostate stimulation, can lead to more frequent ejaculation,‌ which, as we’ve discussed, is​ beneficial. Remember, enjoying one’s‍ sexuality can have numerous health⁢ benefits.
**Host:** It seems like sexual health is intricately linked with physical health. For men who might be hesitant to embrace this information, what advice ‌would‌ you give them?
**Dr. Calvaresi:** I’d say embrace it! Understanding your body and its reactions can empower you, both sexually and physically. ⁢If‌ you’re not comfortable ‌with specific practices, that’s okay. Find what works for you! ‌Regular ‍ejaculation—whether alone or with a partner—can be a key⁤ component of a healthy lifestyle.
**Host:** Great​ advice! Before we wrap​ up, any⁤ final ⁢tips for maintaining prostate health overall?
**Dr. Calvaresi:** Yes, aside from regular ejaculation, maintaining an active‌ lifestyle, eating a balanced diet ⁤rich in fruits and vegetables, and having regular‌ health check-ups ⁣are⁢ all crucial. And don’t forget, keeping‌ the lines of communication open about sexual ⁢health with your partner and healthcare provider is essential.
**Host:** Thank you so much, Dr. Calvaresi, ‍for your insights today. It’s refreshing to discuss ⁢such an important topic in a light-hearted yet informative manner. ​
**Dr. Calvaresi:** Thank you for having‌ me!
**Host:** And to our listeners, ⁤remember: taking care of your prostate can ​be enjoyable—so let’s ⁢make it a priority. Until next⁣ time, keep celebrating good‌ health in joyful ways!

author: nouvelobs.com
title: Paris et Rome dénoncent la condamnation à mort en Iran du rappeur Toomaj Salehi
text:
Un rassemblement pour obtenir la libération du rappeur iranien Toomaj Salehi, à Paris, le 14 mai 2023. CLAIRE SERIE / HANS LUCAS VIA AFP
Par Le Nouvel Obs avec AFP
Publié le 25 avril 2024 à 21h21
En accès libre
Lire plus tard Commenter Masquer ce message Vous voulez participer au débat ?
S’abonner permet de commenter les articles. Et pas que : vous pouvez les consulter et les offrir à vos proches.
Lire les commentaires Offre spéciale : 3€ pour 3 mois Se connecter Partager Masquer ce message Vous souhaitez partager cet article ?
Facebook Twitter E-mail Copier le lien Saisir ici votre nom Adresse email des ou du destinataire Votre message Envoyer La condamnation à mort du rappeur iranien Toomaj Salehi, emprisonné pour son soutien au mouvement de contestation de 2022 en Iran , a été dénoncée ce jeudi 25 avril par la France, l’Italie, et les experts d’un groupe de travail de l’ONU.
« La France condamne avec vigueur cette décision qui s’ajoute aux nombreuses autres condamnations à mort et exécutions injustifiables liées aux manifestations de l’automne 2022 en Iran » , indique le ministère français des Affaires étrangères dans une déclaration.
Publicité
Ces condamnations et les « nombreuses autres violations graves et inacceptables des droits et libertés fondamentales commises par les autorités iraniennes, ne peuvent tenir lieu de réponse aux aspirations légitimes de liberté du peuple iranien » , ajoute la diplomatie française.
A lire aussi
Décryptage Iran : la république des tortionnaires
Abonné
Lire plus tard Le ministre italien des Affaires étrangères Antonio Tajani a lui aussi souligné « condamner fermement » la décision de la justice iranienne.
« Nous continuons de défendre la liberté et les droits de l’homme » « Le gouvernement (italien) s’oppose à la peine de mort en tous lieux et circonstances. Nous continuons de défendre la liberté et les droits de l’homme de par le monde » , a-t-il ajouté dans un communiqué sur les réseaux sociaux.
A Genève, ce sont dix experts indépendants des Nations unies qui ont dénoncé cette condamnation.
« Aussi dures que soient les chansons de Toomaj Salehi à l’égard du gouvernement, elles sont une manifestation de la liberté artistique et des droits culturels » , ont-ils indiqué dans un communiqué, signé par cinq Rapporteurs spéciaux et les cinq membres du Groupe de travail sur la détention arbitraire.
Publicité
A lire aussi
Décryptage Manifestations en Iran : « Si vous en tuez deux, trente les remplaceront »
Abonné
Lire plus tard Ils se disent « alarmés par l’imposition de la peine de mort et les mauvais traitements présumés à l’encontre de Toomaj Salehi qui semblent uniquement liés à l’exercice de son droit à la liberté d’expression artistique et à la créativité » .
En outre, ont-ils ajouté, « les exécutions à l’issue de procès inéquitables constituent une privation arbitraire de la vie » .
Ces experts sont nommés par le Conseil des droits de l’homme de l’ONU mais ne s’expriment pas au nom de l’organisation.
Des centaines de personnes tuées lors de manifestations en Iran Toomaj Salehi, célèbre rappeur de 33 ans, avait été arrêté en octobre 2022. Il avait soutenu, via ses chansons et sur les réseaux sociaux, le mouvement de contestation déclenché après la mort le 16 septembre 2022 de Mahsa Amini , une jeune Kurde iranienne détenue par la police des moeurs, qui lui reprochait d’avoir enfreint le strict code vestimentaire imposé aux femmes.
Publicité
Des artistes étrangers lui avaient alors apporté leur soutien, craignant qu’il ne soit condamné à mort.
A lire aussi
Enquête En Iran, la révolte des écrivaines : « Il y a une hargne à raconter ce qui se passe »
Abonné
Lire plus tard Plusieurs centaines de personnes, dont des membres des forces de l’ordre, ont été tuées et des milliers arrêtés au cours des manifestations qui se sont tenues en octobre et novembre 2022 en Iran, avant de refluer.
Neuf personnes ont été exécutées en lien avec ce soulèvement, selon des ONG.
L’Iran pratique la peine capitale à grande échelle. Amnesty international a recensé 853 exécutions en 2023 , en augmentation de 48 % par rapport à 2022 et de 172 % par rapport à 2021.
Par Le Nouvel Obs avec AFP

author: ansa.it
title: Metalmeccanici, sindacati 'non sarà l'ultimo sciopero' - Notizie - Ansa.it
text:
""Dobbiamo lavorare insieme per il contatto nazionale, che non è di Federmeccanica o dei sindacati, mai dei lavoratori e delle lavoratrici che ogni giorno lavorano per produrre ricchezza per il paese. Ma senza contratto, senza aumenti i lavoratori e le lavatrici diventano sempre più poveri.
 Il contratto nazionale non è solo denaro in più, ma anche diritti come le 35 ore settimanali, e poi la salute e la sicurezza. E non dobbiamo dimenticare la lotta al precariato nel lavoro, nella vita". Così Fabrizio Graziola, segretario generale Fiom Cgil Valle d'Aosta, in occasione della manifestazione di oggi dei sindacati dei metalmeccanici.
 Hans Pistolesi (Fim Cisl), ha sottolineato: "Non è mai stato facile il rinnovo del contratto nazionale, ma questa volta sembra ancora più difficile. Le trattative si sono fermate quattro mesi fa e il contratto è scaduto da giugno scorso.
 Adeguare i contratti significa anche aiutare l'economia. E questo purtroppo non sarà l'ultimo sciopero".
 Per Alessandro D'Amico (Uilm Uil) "siamo qui a rivendicare un contratto nazionale votato dal 98 per cento dei lavoratori e delle lavoratrici: non capiamo questa volontà di Federmeccanica di non ascoltare la nostra voce. Essere qui in piazza è importante e dobbiamo riportare i giovani ".
 "Chiediamo - ha detto Zeno Pucci (Savt industrie) - di rivederci al tavolo e fare ripartire le trattative anche perché in questo momento di incertezza da parte di tutti è fondamentale firmare il contratto ".
 Graziola ha inoltre espresso solidarietà ai 23 dipendenti della Gps standard di Arnad in cassa integrazione dopo l'incendio che nei giorni scorsi ha gravemente danneggiato lo stabilimento. "Siamo preoccupati per il futuro di questi lavoratori e lavoratrici - ha detto dal palco - e credo che si debba trovare una soluzione tutti insieme, con l'azienda, la politica e Confindustria. Perché è dal tema della salute e sicurezza che dobbiamo ripartire".
